intro: Baptistonia cipoensis, commonly known as the Cipo Baptistonia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a lance-shaped appearance. Baptistonia cipoensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
